p:
As part of the sensitivity analysis, Fig 6 explores the impact of the cause “unknown” category data on our estimate of R y. As one can imagine, the estimate of R y would be greater than R y when we discarded unknown data. The scenario-related estimates order ( Fig 6) and the time-dependent patterns of R
y remained unchanged, even when we assigned a certain fraction of the “unknown” causes to the human-to-human transmission events.
